caption: It was a Monday morning, and I was just walking around with no plan when I ended up in this park. There was a choir singing Christmas carols, a holiday market, the smell of food and drinks, and the cathedral in the background. Grab a coffee next door at Shakespeare and Company, sit on a bench, and just enjoy the morning. Such a special park

Magical Place. I saw this place and immediately got connected. I was looking for the Notre Dame Paris and the Abbey Bookshop, and by chance found this little park. I was so impressed by the churches around, the way this place is preserved and how great this tree looks.  I even took a couple of leaves laying on the floor just to have it as a token. The place is really quiet even though it is around a very concurred area. Take at least 30 minutes to enjoy this place.

Such a great little stop on our way back from Norte dame cathedral. Wonderful local foods that made a lasting impression. From dried fruits to specialty hams there is something for everyone. They even had roasted chestnuts!
The place you can enjoy an affordable shopping in Paris and see the great Catholic Cathedral Notre-Dame......

Very beautiful little jardin near the Notre Dame and Pont du Neuf bridge area. Its full of blooming roses in early spring and very beautiful flowers to enjoy your day sitting down rest after long walk.

This is a nice small park I went to during the Christmas season market. They decorate the center with pine trees and light fixtures. The market itself is very small, only about 15 or 20 vendors if not less. The baked goods looked delicious!
A peaceful and scenic little park that offers a quiet reprieve from the busy city streets. Very colorful and pretty in the spring time. Home of the oldest tree in Paris.
One of Paris's fabulous indoor markets
Perfect little Christmas market! During summer I love this square for a little break during the day.

What an amazing place! I was in Paris for a business trip and I had breakfast here (takeaway from a near boulangerie). This park is small but super nice, with a great view on the Notre Dame cathedral and nice flowers.  Thank you to the municipality taking care of this place in such a methodical way. As I was having dinner there I saw the workers keeping the park clean (taking litter from the ground and attending the flowers).
Nice little garden, pretty flowers, lots of benches and nice grass to lay on.

It's the square with the oldest tree in Paris. It's a colossal robinia, planted in 1601. It was planted by the botanist Jean Robin, who introduced the species to France, which is why it bears his name. For over 400 years now, the capital's oldest tree has been in bloom every spring. It now reaches a height of 15 metres and a circumference of 3.50 metres, whereas trees of this species don't usually exceed 10 metres. A concrete structure now supports this historic robinia, which has been classified as a remarkable tree.  The romantic square in the 5th arondissiment is named after Jean Raphaël Adrien René Viviani (8 November 1863 – 7 September 1925) was a French politician of the Third Republic, who served as Prime Minister for the first year of World War I. He was born in Sidi Bel Abbès, in French Algeria.

This is a nice park overlooking the Notre-Dame cathedral. We were here during Christmas so they had an awesome Christmas market. The market was filled with stalls selling cheese, wine, oils, pastries, gifts, jewelry, clothing and ornaments. The square was also decorated in Christmas decorations for the holidays.

Cozy park with the eldest tree of Paris. Nice cozy spot to chill down. Beautiful view on connecting avenues and the Notre Dame. Small church nearby, rebuild after French revolution and has neo classical facade.
Beautiful beautiful flowers arrangements in end of April. Definitely stop by if you are visiting the Notre-Dame church
Lovely little park in Paris near the river Seine. A nice escape with a bit of nature. I could hear birds singing which made me happy. Lots of seating spaciously set out.
Brilliant little park not far from Notre Dame. Nice place to find some peace.
Nice place to stop. Beautiful
Iconic locations to visit while in Paris.
across the Seine from Notre Dame and close to shakespeare book store.  Roses and lacey perennials grace the borders.  sit and feel the antiquity of Paris.  directions in No Worries Paris guidebook
Wonderful. 12 roads connecting to the square. Wow! Undrrpass to cross for pedestrians. Star shape from the top view.

A small city park area sharing space with the 12th century Saint-Julien-le-Pauvre church is dedicated to a famous labor minister and journalist.  In the shadow of the Notre Dame Cathedral, this place features a nice landscaped space, some archeological ruins, plenty of shaded seating, a nice working water fountain, and reportedly Paris’ oldest planted tree!  Like most of Paris, it’s like an onion with many layers and with a lot going on in a very small space.

The Square René Viviani is a city park located slightly to the north of the Gothic church of Saint-Julien-le-Pauvre, built at the same time as Notre-Dame Cathedral and consequently one of Paris' oldest churches. The Square is an irregular polygon in shape, bounded by the Rue Galande and church buildings to the south; by the Rue Saint-Julien-le-Pauvre on the west; by the Quai de Montebello to the north; and by the Rue Lagrange and the Rue du Fouarre on the east. The Rue de la Bûcherie ends on the western side of the square, but it resumes its course on the eastern side, and the Pont au Double, a bridge to the Île de la Cité, lies across the Quai de Montebello from the square. It offers one of the best views of the Cathedral of Notre Dame.  There is an odd-looking fountain, known as the Saint Julien fountain, that was erected in 1995. It is the work of the French sculptor, Georges Jeanclos (1933–1997), and it is emblematic of the legend of St. Julien the Hospitaller, a tale, now largely discounted, involving a curse by witches, a talking deer, a case of mistaken identity, an horrific crime, several improbable coincidences, and a supernatural intervention. The story was told and retold during the Middle Ages, and it became a favorite. Consequently, hospitals, hospices, and churches all over Europe adopted Julien as their patron. He was also a patron saint of hunters, innkeepers, and ferrymen; traveling pilgrims often prayed for his help in finding comfortable lodgings.  The other feature worthy of note is an ancient tree.  The Square René Viviani is named for the French political figure René Viviani (1863–1925) who, notably, was France's first Minister of Labour. After several old buildings standing on the site were cleared away in 1928, including an annex of the public hospital across the river, the empty space was arranged to be a public park.
Such a pretty place! And there was a Christmas Market while we were there
Nice garden even though it was wintertime.

One of my favorite Paris parks. You sure can't beat that view! Rest your feet and take a nap on one of the benches towards the back, or bring a blanket and let your eyes relax on the grass (forbidden at most parks in Paris!) followed by a picnic. There is a franprix market 2 minutes away towards Maubert Mutualité where you can grab wine and snacks. Just watch out for the rats... 🐁
Fun esp they are preparing Olympics 2024!
Great historic attraction. Very long queues.
Town center old town a lot of out door restaurant in summer time on August beautiful nice place
Nice little spot to relax and eat some snacks. Great view of the Norte Dame Cathedral.
some dude talked to jean and some cannibals were running at us thankfully my musket and my bros blunderbuss held them off, my other bro was building defenses and we got in a boat and left
Beautiful park on The Seine across from Notre Dame Cathedral. Here you will find the oldest tree and the oldest church (Church of Saint-Julien-le-Pauvre) in Paris.
Amazing Christmas Market ❤️
Wonderful spot to enjoy the center of Paris from. Near many good cafes/restaurants.
Very pretty garden.
One of my favorite views of Notre Dame don't miss the oldest planted tree in Paris in 1602
Nice little park, beautiful roses
Cute little park with some seating.
